content:
You're in for a treat! Cafe Reggio and Caffe Dante are two of the most iconic coffee shops in New York City, and they're must-visits for any coffee lover. You'll feel like you're stepping back in time when you walk into these classic spots.

**Cafe Reggio:**

* Address: 119 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012
* Hours: Monday - Thursday: 8am - 10pm, Friday - Saturday: 8am - 11pm, Sunday: 9am - 10pm
* Must-try: Cappuccino or Espresso, paired with a classic Italian pastry like a cornetto or sfogliatelle

**Caffe Dante:**

* Address: 79-81 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012
* Hours: Monday - Thursday: 8am - 10pm, Friday - Saturday: 8am - 11pm, Sunday: 9am - 10pm
* Must-try: Cappuccino or Latte, paired with a delicious pastry like a croissant or muffin

Both of these coffee shops have been around for over 100 years, and they're still serving up some of the best coffee in the city. You'll love the old-school vibe, the expertly crafted coffee drinks, and the delicious pastries.

After you've fueled up on coffee, you'll be ready to take on your pizza adventures! Lombardi's and Joe's are just a short walk from these coffee shops, so you can grab a slice (or two) after your coffee break.

Enjoy your coffee and pizza adventures in New York City!
